bibl.title: Wiley v. Keokuk. Petition in Error
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
Albert Wiley Plaintiff
against
Keokuk, Chief of the
Sac & Fox Indians
Defendant }

In the Supreme Court
of the State of Kansas
Petition in Error

The said plaintiff complains of said defendant for that the said defendant at the special April term of the district Court A.D. 1869, for said County of Days in the State of Kansas, recovered a judgm by the consideration of said court again the said plaintiff in a certain action pending in said court wherein the said Keokuk chief of the Sac & Fox Indians, plaintiff and the said Albert Wiley. Charles C. Mix. Thomas Murphy, Thomas Do William P. Monlgiong, were defendants a copy of the case made duly certified is hereto attached marked A, and the said Albert Wiley avers that there is error in the record and proceedings, in this to wit,
1st That the said court erred in overruling the plaintiffs challenge for, cause, of Walter a juror
2d That the said Court erred in the instruction given to the jury, on the tried of said action.
3d That the said court erred in refusing to give the instructions which the said Albert Wiley prayed the Court to give the jury.
4h That the verdict of the jury & judgement of said court is not sustained by the evidence and is contrary to law.
5th That the damages given by the jury and the judgement against said Albert Wiley are excessive.
6th That the judgement was given for the said Keokuk when it ought to have been given for the said Albert Wiley according to law

7th That the Court erred in overruling the said Albert Wileys Motion for a new trial. That said plaintiff therefore prays that the said judgment may be reversed, and the said plaintiff restored to all things he has lost by reason therefor.

Riggs Nevison & Foote
Attorneys for Plaintiff

Albert Wiley Pltff.
against
Keokuk Chief of the
sac & Fox Indians Deft. }
In the Supreme Court of State of Kansas Court Error

I do hereby Waive the and service of summons in the above entitled
Action

Lawrence October 19th AD 1869,
James Christian
attorney for defendant

I enter for costs in this action,
John K. Rankin
